pl_translation: wciąż, nadal, jeszcze; spokojny, nieruchomy; fotos; uspokajać
en_definition: Adverb: continuing to happen or exist; up to and including the present or the time mentioned; despite that; nevertheless; even; yet. Adjective: not moving or making a sound; deep silence and calm; of a drink, not carbonated. Noun: a static photograph, especially from a movie; apparatus for distilling liquids. Verb: make or become still; quieten.
pl_definition: Przysłówek: wciąż, nadal, jeszcze; mimo to; nawet. Przymiotnik: nieruchomy, spokojny, cichy; niegazowany (o napoju). Rzeczownik: fotos, zdjęcie nieruchome (zwł. z filmu); aparat destylacyjny. Czasownik: uspokajać, uciszać; nieruchomieć.
examples: She is still waiting for the bus.
The lake was perfectly still in the morning.
Please still your mind during meditation.

en_definition: a plan of action designed to achieve a long-term or overall aim
pl_definition: plan działania mający na celu osiągnięcie długoterminowego lub ogólnego celu
examples: The company developed a new marketing strategy to increase sales.
Her strategy for winning the chess game involved sacrificing a pawn early.
The government's economic strategy focuses on reducing inflation.

en_definition: A state of mental or emotional strain or tension resulting from adverse or demanding circumstances.
pl_definition: Stan napięcia psychicznego lub emocjonalnego wynikający z niekorzystnych lub wymagających okoliczności.
examples: The constant pressure at work caused him a lot of stress.
She uses meditation to manage her daily stress.
Financial problems are a common source of stress for many families.

en_definition: A particular manner or way of doing something, or a distinctive appearance, design, or fashion.
pl_definition: Sposób wykonania czegoś, charakterystyczny wygląd, projekt lub moda.
examples: Her writing style is clear and concise.
He has a unique style of dressing.
The building features a modern architectural style.

en_definition: A particular manner or way of doing something; distinctive appearance, design, or arrangement.
pl_definition: Sposób, w jaki coś jest zrobione lub wygląda; charakterystyczny wygląd, projekt lub układ.
examples: She has three different styles of dresses in her closet.
The architect is known for his modern styles of building design.
They discussed various teaching styles during the workshop.

en_definition: to mention an idea, possible plan, or action for other people to consider
pl_definition: wspominać pomysł, możliwy plan lub działanie, aby inni mogli je rozważyć
examples: He suggests we meet at the cafe.
The data suggests a change in strategy.
She suggests taking a different route.

en_definition: to achieve the desired aim or result; to accomplish what was attempted
pl_definition: osiągnąć zamierzony cel lub rezultat; zrealizować to, co było próbowane
examples: She succeeded in passing the exam on her first attempt.
The team succeeded in completing the project ahead of schedule.
After many failures, he finally succeeded in fixing the old car.

en_definition: The star at the center of the solar system, which provides light and heat to Earth.
pl_definition: Gwiazda w centrum Układu Słonecznego, która dostarcza światła i ciepła Ziemi.
examples: The sun rises in the east every morning.
We sat outside to enjoy the warm sun.
Plants need sunlight to grow properly.

en_definition: 1. A set of clothes made of the same fabric, typically a jacket and trousers or a jacket and skirt. 2. A legal action or process. 3. To be appropriate or acceptable for someone or something.
pl_definition: 1. Garnitur (ubranie składające się z marynarki i spodni/spódnicy z tej samej tkaniny). 2. Pozew, sprawa sądowa. 3. Pasować, być odpowiednim dla kogoś lub czegoś.
examples: He wore a dark blue suit to the interview.
The company filed a suit against its competitor.
That color really suits your complexion.

en_definition: The outside part or uppermost layer of something; the top layer of a liquid.
pl_definition: Zewnętrzna część lub wierzchnia warstwa czegoś; górna warstwa cieczy.
examples: The table has a smooth surface.
Fish swim near the water's surface.
The moon's surface is covered in craters.

en_definition: to continue to live or exist, especially after a dangerous event or difficult situation
pl_definition: przetrwać, przeżyć, przetrzymać
examples: Only three people survived the plane crash.
The ancient ruins have survived for thousands of years.
She survived cancer and now helps other patients.

en_definition: A device for making and breaking the connection in an electric circuit; to change or exchange something.
pl_definition: Urządzenie do zamykania i otwierania obwodu elektrycznego; zmienić lub zamienić coś.
examples: Flip the switch to turn on the light.
She decided to switch careers from teaching to programming.
Can we switch seats? I can't see the screen from here.

en_definition: The application of scientific knowledge for practical purposes, especially in industry, engineering, and the development of machinery and devices.
pl_definition: Zastosowanie wiedzy naukowej do celów praktycznych, zwłaszcza w przemyśle, inżynierii oraz rozwoju maszyn i urządzeń.
examples: Modern technology has transformed how we communicate.
The company invests heavily in new technology.
Medical technology continues to advance rapidly.

en_definition: constituting number ten in a sequence; 10th; one of ten equal parts of something
pl_definition: stanowiący liczbę dziesięć w kolejności; dziesiąty; jedna z dziesięciu równych części czegoś
examples: She finished in tenth place in the race.
This is the tenth time I've called you today.
Only a tenth of the original forest remains.

en_definition: A country in Central Europe, officially the Swiss Confederation, known for its mountains, neutrality, and financial sector.
pl_definition: Państwo w Europie Środkowej, oficjalnie Konfederacja Szwajcarska, znane z gór, neutralności i sektora finansowego.
examples: Switzerland is famous for its chocolate and watches.
Many international organizations have their headquarters in Switzerland.
We went skiing in the Swiss Alps last winter.

en_definition: The degree or intensity of heat present in a substance or object, especially as expressed according to a comparative scale and shown by a thermometer or perceived by touch.
pl_definition: Stopień lub intensywność ciepła obecnego w substancji lub obiekcie, zwłaszcza wyrażony według skali porównawczej i pokazywany przez termometr lub odczuwany przez dotyk.
examples: The temperatures in the desert can vary dramatically between day and night.
Scientists are monitoring ocean temperatures to study climate change.
Please check the patient's temperatures every four hours.

en_definition: extremely bad or serious; causing great fear or suffering
pl_definition: bardzo zły lub poważny; wywołujący wielki strach lub cierpienie
examples: The weather was terrible during our vacation.
He had a terrible accident on the highway.
I feel terrible about forgetting her birthday.

en_definition: used to introduce the second element in a comparison
pl_definition: używane do wprowadzenia drugiego elementu w porównaniu
examples: She is taller than her brother.
I would rather walk than drive.
It is better to be safe than sorry.

en_definition: the process of evaluating or examining something to determine its quality, performance, or reliability
pl_definition: proces oceny lub badania czegoś w celu określenia jego jakości, wydajności lub niezawodności
examples: The software is currently undergoing testing.
We need to complete the testing phase before launch.
Testing revealed several bugs in the system.

en_definition: belonging to or associated with the people or things previously mentioned or easily identified
pl_definition: należący do lub związany z osobami lub rzeczami wcześniej wspomnianymi lub łatwo zidentyfikowanymi
examples: They forgot their books at home.
The students completed their assignments.
The team celebrated their victory.

en_definition: used before a noun to indicate that the noun is known to the reader or listener
pl_definition: używany przed rzeczownikiem, aby wskazać, że rzeczownik jest znany czytelnikowi lub słuchaczowi
examples: The cat is on the mat.
I saw the movie yesterday.
The sun rises in the east.

en_definition: Used to identify a specific person or thing observed or heard by the speaker; introducing a subordinate clause; to such a degree.
pl_definition: Używane do wskazania konkretnej osoby lub rzeczy; wprowadzające zdanie podrzędne; do takiego stopnia.
examples: I know that person.
She said that she would come.
It wasn't that difficult.

en_definition: At that time; next or after that; in that case.
pl_definition: Wtedy; następnie; w takim razie.
examples: We went to the store, then we came home.
If it rains, then we'll stay inside.
First mix the ingredients, then bake for 30 minutes.

en_definition: Used as the object of a verb or preposition to refer to two or more people or things previously mentioned or easily identified.
pl_definition: Używany jako dopełnienie czasownika lub przyimka, odnosząc się do dwóch lub więcej osób lub rzeczy wcześniej wspomnianych lub łatwo rozpoznawalnych.
examples: I gave them the book yesterday.
The teacher praised them for their hard work.
Please send the email to them by tomorrow.

en_definition: Used to refer to two or more people or things that are near the speaker or writer.
pl_definition: Używane do odnoszenia się do dwóch lub więcej osób lub rzeczy znajdujących się blisko mówiącego lub piszącego.
examples: These books are very interesting.
I bought these apples yesterday.
These students are from Poland.

en_definition: Used to indicate a place, point, or position; also used to introduce a sentence or clause.
pl_definition: Używane do wskazania miejsca, punktu lub pozycji; także używane do wprowadzania zdania lub klauzuli.
examples: I left my keys over there on the table.
There is a cat sitting on the fence.
We should go there for our vacation next year.

en_definition: objects, items, or matters that are not specifically named
pl_definition: przedmioty, rzeczy lub sprawy, które nie są konkretnie nazwane
examples: I need to pack my things for the trip.
She has many interesting things in her collection.
We discussed important things during the meeting.

pl_translation: oni/one (liczba mnoga); on/ona (liczba pojedyncza, gdy płeć nieznana lub niebinarna)
en_definition: Used to refer to two or more people or things previously mentioned or easily identified; also used as a singular pronoun to refer to a person whose gender is non-binary or unspecified.
pl_definition: Używane w odniesieniu do dwóch lub więcej osób lub rzeczy wcześniej wspomnianych lub łatwych do zidentyfikowania; również używane jako zaimek liczby pojedynczej w odniesieniu do osoby, której płeć jest niebinarna lub nieokreślona.
examples: They are going to the store together.
If someone calls, tell them I'll call back.
They left their umbrella at the restaurant.

en_definition: having less width or thickness than something else; of smaller dimensions in cross-section.
pl_definition: mający mniejszą szerokość lub grubość niż coś innego; o mniejszych wymiarach w przekroju.
examples: This paper is thinner than the other one.
She wants a thinner slice of cake.
The new model is much thinner and lighter.

en_definition: Used to identify a specific person or thing close at hand or being indicated or experienced.
pl_definition: Używane do wskazania konkretnej osoby, rzeczy lub sytuacji znajdującej się blisko lub właśnie wskazywanej.
examples: This book is very interesting.
I like this color more than that one.
This is my favorite song.

en_definition: A male given name of Aramaic origin meaning 'twin'.
pl_definition: Męskie imię pochodzenia aramejskiego oznaczające 'bliźniak'.
examples: Thomas is coming to the meeting tomorrow.
I met Thomas at the conference last week.
Thomas enjoys reading historical novels.

en_definition: an idea or opinion produced by thinking, or occurring suddenly in the mind
pl_definition: pomysł lub opinia powstała w wyniku myślenia lub pojawiająca się nagle w umyśle
examples: The sudden thought made her smile.
He shared his thoughts on the project.
A troubling thought kept her awake.

en_definition: A long, thin strand of cotton, nylon, or other fibers used in sewing or weaving; also, a theme or sequence of events in a narrative.
pl_definition: Długa, cienka nitka z bawełny, nylonu lub innych włókien używana w szyciu lub tkaniu; także motyw lub ciąg wydarzeń w narracji.
examples: She carefully threaded the needle with a blue thread.
The thread of the story was difficult to follow.
He lost the thread of the conversation after the interruption.

en_definition: moving in one side and out of the other side of (an opening, channel, or location); continuing in time toward completion of (a process or period); by means of (a process or intermediate stage).
pl_definition: przemieszczanie się z jednej strony na drugą przez (otwór, kanał lub miejsce); kontynuowanie w czasie do zakończenia (procesu lub okresu); za pomocą (procesu lub etapu pośredniego).
examples: We walked through the tunnel.
She read through the entire book in one day.
He succeeded through hard work.

en_definition: 1. (noun) A period or instance of occurrence; a multiplication factor. 2. (preposition) Multiplied by. 3. (verb) To multiply or measure the duration of.
pl_definition: 1. (rzeczownik) Okres lub instancja występowania; czynnik mnożenia. 2. (przyimek) Pomnożone przez. 3. (czasownik) Mnożyć lub mierzyć czas trwania.
examples: I have visited Paris three times.
Four times five equals twenty.
She times her runs with a stopwatch.

en_definition: a statement of an intention to inflict pain, injury, damage, or other hostile action on someone in retribution for something done or not done; a person or thing likely to cause damage or danger
pl_definition: wyrażenie zamiaru wyrządzenia komuś krzywdy, szkody lub innych wrogich działań w odwecie za coś zrobionego lub niezrobionego; osoba lub rzecz mogąca spowodować szkodę lub niebezpieczeństwo
examples: The email contained a direct threat against the company's CEO.
Climate change poses a serious threat to coastal communities worldwide.
The aggressive dog was perceived as a threat by the neighbors.

en_definition: the present day or time
pl_definition: obecny dzień lub czas
examples: I will finish the report today.
Today is a beautiful day.
What are your plans for today?

en_definition: Used to indicate direction, purpose, or relationship between things.
pl_definition: Używane do wskazywania kierunku, celu lub relacji między rzeczami.
examples: I'm going to the store.
She gave the book to her friend.
He wants to learn to play guitar.

en_definition: the capital and largest city of Japan, located on the island of Honshu
pl_definition: stolica i największe miasto Japonii, położone na wyspie Honsiu
examples: Tokyo is known for its bustling streets and advanced technology.
We visited Tokyo during cherry blossom season.
The Tokyo Skytree offers panoramic views of the city.

en_definition: past tense and past participle of 'tell'; to have communicated information, facts, or news to someone
pl_definition: czas przeszły i imiesłów bierny od 'tell'; przekazać komuś informacje, fakty lub wiadomości
examples: She told me about her trip to Paris.
He told the children a bedtime story.
They told us the meeting was cancelled.

en_definition: to a higher degree than is desirable, permissible, or possible; excessively; also; in addition; moreover.
pl_definition: w stopniu wyższym niż jest to pożądane, dopuszczalne lub możliwe; nadmiernie; również; ponadto; co więcej.
examples: The coffee is too hot to drink.
She wants to come too.
It's too late to change plans now.

en_definition: to make an attempt or effort to do something
pl_definition: próbować, starać się coś zrobić
examples: I will try to finish the report today.
She tried calling him several times.
Let's try a different approach to solve this problem.

en_definition: in a truthful way; genuinely or sincerely; to the fullest degree
pl_definition: w sposób prawdziwy; szczerze; w pełnym stopniu
examples: I truly believe we can succeed.
She was truly grateful for their help.
This is truly the best cake I've ever tasted.

en_definition: A hard, dense, gray-white metallic element with a high melting point, used especially in electrical applications and as an alloying agent.
pl_definition: Twardy, gęsty, szaro-biały metal o wysokiej temperaturze topnienia, stosowany szczególnie w zastosowaniach elektrycznych i jako składnik stopów.
examples: Tungsten filaments are commonly used in incandescent light bulbs.
The drill bit contains tungsten carbide for increased durability.
Tungsten has the highest melting point of all metals.

en_definition: to move or cause to move in a circular direction around a central point; to change direction or position; to become or cause to become something different
pl_definition: poruszać się lub powodować ruch w kierunku kołowym wokół centralnego punktu; zmieniać kierunek lub pozycję; stać się lub spowodować, aby stać się czymś innym
examples: He turned the key in the lock.
The weather turned cold overnight.
She turned to face the audience.

en_definition: having the distinctive qualities of a particular type of person or thing; characteristic
pl_definition: mający charakterystyczne cechy danego typu osoby lub rzeczy; reprezentatywny
examples: A typical day at the office starts with checking emails.
This is a typical example of Renaissance architecture.
She gave a typical response when asked about her plans.

en_definition: Up to the point in time or the event mentioned; before (a specified time).
pl_definition: Do określonego momentu w czasie lub zdarzenia; przed (określonym czasem).
examples: Wait here until I return.
The store is open until 9 PM.
He didn't know the truth until yesterday.

en_definition.noun: a change in direction or position; an opportunity or time to do something in a sequence; a short performance or act
en_definition.verb: to move or cause to move in a circular direction around an axis; to change direction or position; to become or cause to become something different

pl_definition.noun: zmiana kierunku lub pozycji; okazja lub czas na zrobienie czegoś w kolejności; krótki występ lub akt
pl_definition.verb: poruszać się lub powodować ruch w kierunku kołowym wokół osi; zmieniać kierunek lub pozycję; stać się lub powodować, że coś stanie się inne

examples: The car made three sharp turns before stopping.
It's your turn to wash the dishes tonight.
The weather turned cold suddenly in the afternoon.

pl_translation: w górę, do góry, na górze, wzwyż
en_definition: In or to a higher position or level; moving or looking upward; toward a higher or more advanced state.
pl_definition: W górę, do góry; w kierunku wyższego położenia lub poziomu; wskazujący ruch lub kierunek ku górze.
examples: The balloon floated up into the sky.
She looked up from her book when I entered.
Prices have gone up since last year.

en_definition: to employ for a purpose; to put into service
pl_definition: używać, stosować, wykorzystywać
examples: I use a pen to write notes.
She uses her phone to check the weather.
They use public transportation to commute.

en_definition: the latest information or news about something, or the act of making something more modern or effective
pl_definition: najnowsze informacje lub wiadomości na jakiś temat, lub czynność uczynienia czegoś bardziej nowoczesnym lub skutecznym
examples: I'll send you updates on the project progress.
The app requires regular updates to function properly.
Check the website for the latest updates on the event.

en_definition: to improve the quality or usefulness of something, or to raise it to a higher standard
pl_definition: ulepszyć coś, podnieść jego jakość lub standard, zmodernizować
examples: They plan to upgrade the software next month.
We upgraded our seats to business class.
The company is upgrading its security systems.

en_definition: adjective: previously owned or employed; verb: employed for a purpose or accustomed to something
pl_definition: przymiotnik: używany, używany wcześniej; czasownik (czas przeszły od 'use'): użyty, przyzwyczajony
examples: I bought a used car from the dealership.
She used to live in Warsaw before moving to Krakow.
He used all the ingredients to make the cake.

en_definition: to employ for some purpose; to put into service
pl_definition: używać, stosować, wykorzystywać
examples: She uses a computer for her work.
He uses public transportation daily.
This recipe uses fresh ingredients.

en_definition: Employing or utilizing something for a particular purpose.
pl_definition: Stosowanie lub wykorzystywanie czegoś do określonego celu.
examples: She is using a computer to write her essay.
He learned English by using language apps.
They are using recycled materials for the project.

en_definition: to a high degree; extremely
pl_definition: w bardzo dużym stopniu; niezwykle
examples: It's very cold outside today.
She was very happy with the results.
This coffee is very strong.

en_definition: A space entirely devoid of matter; or to clean with a vacuum cleaner.
pl_definition: Przestrzeń całkowicie pozbawiona materii; lub czyścić odkurzaczem.
examples: He used a vacuum to clean the carpet.
Outer space is nearly a perfect vacuum.
She will vacuum the living room tomorrow.

en_definition: capable of working successfully; feasible
pl_definition: zdolny do funkcjonowania z sukcesem; wykonalny
examples: The plan is viable with our current budget.
We need to find a viable solution to this problem.
The business model must be viable to attract investors.

en_definition: A recording of moving visual images made digitally or on videotape.
pl_definition: Nagranie ruchomych obrazów wizualnych wykonane cyfrowo lub na taśmie wideo.
examples: I watched a video about space exploration.
She uploaded a video to her social media account.
The teacher showed an educational video in class.

en_definition: desired, sought after, or required
pl_definition: pożądany, poszukiwany lub wymagany
examples: The police are looking for a wanted criminal.
She is a wanted guest at every party.
This job requires a wanted skill set.

en_definition: past tense first and third person singular of 'be'
pl_definition: czas przeszły pierwszej i trzeciej osoby liczby pojedynczej czasownika 'być'
examples: He was at home yesterday.
The weather was beautiful last week.
She was happy to see her friend.

en_definition: A network of interconnected burrows where rabbits or other animals live; also used figuratively to describe a densely populated or labyrinthine place.
pl_definition: Sieć połączonych ze sobą nor, w których żyją króliki lub inne zwierzęta; używane również przenośnie do opisania gęsto zaludnionego lub labiryntowego miejsca.
examples: The rabbits disappeared into their warren when they heard a noise.
The old part of the city was a warren of narrow streets and alleys.
Her mind was a warren of memories and ideas.

en_definition: Used by a speaker to refer to himself or herself and one or more other people considered together.
pl_definition: Używane przez mówcę, aby odnosić się do siebie i jednej lub więcej innych osób razem.
examples: We are going to the store.
We enjoyed the movie last night.
We need to finish this project.

en_definition: A unit of power in the International System of Units (SI), equal to one joule per second, used to measure the rate of energy transfer or conversion.
pl_definition: Jednostka mocy w Międzynarodowym Układzie Jednostek (SI), równa jednemu dżulowi na sekundę, używana do pomiaru szybkości przekazywania lub przetwarzania energii.
examples: The light bulb consumes 60 watts of power.
This amplifier delivers 100 watts per channel.
Solar panels on the roof can generate up to 300 watts in direct sunlight.

en_definition: reduced in strength, intensity, or effectiveness
pl_definition: osłabiony, zmniejszony w sile, intensywności lub skuteczności
examples: The weakened structure could not withstand the storm.
Her immune system was weakened after the illness.
The team's defense was weakened by the player's absence.

en_definition: having less physical strength, power, or intensity; less strong or effective
pl_definition: mający mniejszą siłę fizyczną, moc lub intensywność; mniej silny lub skuteczny
examples: The weaker team lost the match by a large margin.
After the illness, he felt much weaker than before.
The signal became weaker as we moved further from the tower.

en_definition: used to ask for information about something or someone
pl_definition: używane do zadawania pytań o informacje dotyczące czegoś lub kogoś
examples: What is your name?
What time is it?
What did you say?

en_definition: at what time; at, on, or during which
pl_definition: kiedy; w czasie którego
examples: When did you arrive?
I remember when we first met.
Call me when you're ready.

en_definition: past tense second person singular, past tense plural, and past subjunctive of 'be'
pl_definition: czas przeszły drugiej osoby liczby pojedynczej, czas przeszły liczby mnogiej oraz tryb przypuszczający czasownika 'być'
examples: We were at the park yesterday.
If I were you, I would study more.
They were happy to see us.

en_definition: during the time that; at the same time as; whereas (indicating contrast)
pl_definition: podczas gdy; w czasie gdy; podczas kiedy; natomiast (wskazując kontrast)
examples: She read a book while waiting for the bus.
While I enjoy coffee, my sister prefers tea.
He listened to music while doing his homework.

en_definition: of the color of milk or fresh snow, due to the reflection of most wavelengths of visible light; the opposite of black
pl_definition: koloru mleka lub świeżego śniegu, odbijający większość długości fal światła widzialnego; przeciwieństwo czarnego
examples: The walls were painted white.
She wore a white dress to the wedding.
Snow covered the ground in a blanket of white.

en_definition: accompanied by; having; using; in relation to; because of
pl_definition: wraz z; z; przy użyciu; w odniesieniu do; z powodu
examples: She went to the park with her dog.
He wrote the letter with a pen.
I agree with your opinion.

en_definition: for what reason or purpose; used to ask about the cause, reason, or purpose of something
pl_definition: dlaczego, po co; używane do pytania o przyczynę, powód lub cel czegoś
examples: Why are you leaving so early?
I wonder why she didn't call.
Why did you choose this restaurant?

en_definition: Activity involving mental or physical effort done to achieve a purpose or result; to engage in such activity.
pl_definition: Działanie wymagające wysiłku umysłowego lub fizycznego, mające na celu osiągnięcie określonego celu lub rezultatu; angażowanie się w takie działanie.
examples: She has a lot of work to finish by Friday.
He works as a software engineer.
The machine doesn't work properly.

en_definition: people who work, especially those who do manual or industrial labor
pl_definition: osoby pracujące, zwłaszcza wykonujące pracę fizyczną lub przemysłową
examples: The factory employs over 500 workers.
Construction workers were repairing the road.
Healthcare workers are essential to our community.

en_definition: past tense and past participle of 'work'; to have performed labor, tasks, or duties; to have functioned or operated effectively.
pl_definition: czas przeszły i imiesłów bierny od 'work'; oznacza wykonanie pracy, zadań lub obowiązków; funkcjonowanie lub działanie skutecznie.
examples: She worked hard to finish the project on time.
The machine worked perfectly after the repair.
They worked together to solve the problem.

en_definition: the earth, together with all of its countries, peoples, and natural features; a particular region or group of countries; human society and its affairs; a particular group of living things or a particular class of things.
pl_definition: Ziemia wraz ze wszystkimi krajami, ludźmi i cechami naturalnymi; określony region lub grupa krajów; społeczeństwo ludzkie i jego sprawy; określona grupa istot żywych lub klasa rzeczy.
examples: She traveled around the world last year.
The world of professional sports is highly competitive.
He wants to make the world a better place.

en_definition: As a noun: literary, artistic, or musical compositions or productions; a place where industrial or manufacturing processes are carried out. As a verb: third-person singular present of 'work', meaning to be engaged in physical or mental activity to achieve a purpose.
pl_definition: Jako rzeczownik: dzieła literackie, artystyczne lub muzyczne; miejsce, w którym prowadzone są procesy przemysłowe lub produkcyjne. Jako czasownik: trzecia osoba liczby pojedynczej czasu teraźniejszego od 'work', oznaczająca zaangażowanie w aktywność fizyczną lub umysłową w celu osiągnięcia celu.
examples: She works at a hospital as a nurse.
His collected works include novels and essays.
The factory works around the clock to meet demand.

en_definition: belonging to or associated with the world; of or relating to the entire planet or its inhabitants
pl_definition: należący do świata lub związany ze światem; dotyczący całej planety lub jej mieszkańców
examples: The world's population continues to grow each year.
She traveled to see the world's most famous landmarks.
Protecting the world's oceans is crucial for our future.

en_definition: comparative form of 'bad'; of lower quality or more unpleasant than something else
pl_definition: stopień wyższy od 'bad'; gorszy, o niższej jakości lub bardziej nieprzyjemny niż coś innego
examples: The weather today is worse than yesterday.
His second attempt was even worse than the first.
This situation is getting worse by the minute.

en_definition: Used to express a conditional mood, future in the past, habitual action in the past, or polite requests.
pl_definition: Używane do wyrażania trybu warunkowego, przyszłości w przeszłości, nawykowych czynności w przeszłości lub grzecznych próśb.
examples: I would go if I had time.
She said she would call later.
Would you please pass the salt?

en_definition: not correct or true; mistaken
pl_definition: niepoprawny lub nieprawdziwy; błędny
examples: The answer was wrong.
He gave the wrong directions.
She pressed the wrong button.

en_definition: a period of 365 or 366 days, divided into 12 months, starting from January 1 and ending on December 31
pl_definition: okres 365 lub 366 dni, podzielony na 12 miesięcy, rozpoczynający się 1 stycznia i kończący 31 grudnia
examples: I visited Japan last year.
She will graduate next year.
The project took three years to complete.

en_definition: belonging to or associated with a year; a contraction of 'year is' or 'year has' in informal contexts
pl_definition: przynależny do roku lub związany z rokiem; skrót od 'year is' lub 'year has' w kontekstach nieformalnych
examples: This year's harvest was abundant.
Last year's report showed growth.
Next year's budget is being planned.

en_definition: up until the present or a specified time; but nevertheless; in addition
pl_definition: do teraźniejszości lub określonego czasu; ale mimo to; dodatkowo
examples: I haven't finished my homework yet.
She is tired, yet she continues to work.
There is yet another problem to solve.

en_definition: A period of 365 days (or 366 in a leap year), used for measuring age or duration; also refers to a long period of time.
pl_definition: Okres 365 dni (lub 366 w roku przestępnym), używany do mierzenia wieku lub czasu trwania; odnosi się również do długiego okresu.
examples: She has lived in Paris for five years.
The project took three years to complete.
He looks young for his years.

en_definition: used to refer to the person or people that the speaker is addressing
pl_definition: używane do odniesienia się do osoby lub osób, do których mówca się zwraca
examples: You are my best friend.
Can you help me with this?
I will see you tomorrow.

pl_translation: twój, twoja, twoje, wasz, wasza, wasze
en_definition: belonging to or associated with the person or people that the speaker is addressing
pl_definition: należący do lub związany z osobą lub osobami, do których mówca się zwraca
examples: Is this your book?
Your ideas are very interesting.
I saw your brother yesterday.

pl_translation: twój, twoja, twoje, wasz, wasza, wasze
en_definition: belonging to or associated with the person or people that the speaker is addressing
pl_definition: należący do osoby lub osób, do których mówiący się zwraca
examples: Is this book yours?
The choice is yours to make.
My car is blue, and yours is red.
